string.text: Help me out, man!
What is it? What happened?

I'm in a pinch. Two of my friends were taken captive by bandits. I don't know what the hell they want, 'cause we're short on loot anyway. Help me free them, will you? They're held at the abandoned vehicle park.
How many bandits are in the camp?
Nine of 'em.
You kidding? How do you plan on the two of us grabbing your friends?
Through the element of surprise. I have a plan... two, in fact. So, you helping me? Quid pro quo — I'll pay you, don't worry.
What are our options? Sorry, but if it's something phoney, count me out.

We need to distract the bandits. They'll cause a commotion, and I'll drop 'em from behind. I've got a couple of options: either we enter through the hole in the fence and get 'em from the rear or we climb the hill and shoot down a couple of 'em from there. The rest is simple.
So I'm supposed to distract them? How will I do that?
They won't fire at you — they need stalkers alive for some reason. That's why you'll just go up and talk to them, and in that time, I'll pop a few. Sound good?
"Sound good" my ass! You really think you can carry through with this plan?
I'm sure — just trust me! And, you know... I've got money! I'll give you ten grand in advance. Deal?
Alright, deal. Let's just decide first on how you'll be using your sneakiness.
Sorry, but I'm not going up against nine bandits, much less as bait. Good luck to you.
As I said, we could sneak through the bushes in the vehicle graveyard itself. Or we could take the hill, where everything is perfectly visible.
Let's take the bushes. There's quite the distance between the hill and the bandits, and we don't need to go rambo.
It's best we go on the hill. More visibility there.
I changed my mind.
Let's go, then!
Let's move!
Looks like we did it...
He-ey, you're the man! We sure whooped some ass, didn't we?
You're not half bad either. Nice acting there!
And, uh... you can have your money back. I don't feel like taking it.
Glad to help.
Thanks, stalker! Maybe the Zone will have us cross paths again. And good deeds are always rewarded. Gotta give you this little present.
Thanks, stalker. So what made you come to the Garbage? I haven't seen you around here before — need help with anything?
Thanks! Could you tell me what's there to do in the Garbage? Where could I eat or earn some cash?
Yeah, it's my first time here. Could you tell me what's there to do in the Garbage? Where could I make a profit?

There's really not much to do in this place. My boys and I are thinking of going further, toward the Red Forest — dangerous, but well-paid. But that's for another time — gotta rest. Here, though, I suppose you could work for the local trader. Go see him — he's by the abandoned hangar.
Thanks, man. Later.
God damn — we gotta beat it out of here! We're heading to the hangar, into our base. You with us?
Yeah, let's move!
I think I'll be going solo for a bit. Good luck, boys.
Thanks for the help, man. Won't forget it!
Who the hell are you? Get on out of here!
Well, someone's in a good mood today...
Stop right there! Where you headed?
Hey! I'd like to see the trader.
You can't see him right now. He's busy!
Is he gonna be busy for long?
Dunno. Crutch was having a visit from some important people. He ain't exactly in the talking mood after seeing them — told me not to let anyone in. So go do something else.
I see...
What do you want now? I told you how it is!
I'm leaving.
Where you heading?
To the trader. Is he free?
He's free. Go on in — just don't do anything stupid.
Just let me in, for Christ's sake.
I hope Crutch didn't bite, huh, stalker?
Cranky guy, for sure.

He usually doesn't do business with people he doesn't know; add to that the fact that he's got some rather large problems on his hands, and you can understand why he's like that. Did you see the people who visited him? I heard they were making threats.
Are they competitors?
No damn clue... Hold up! I wanna make you an offer — we'll both come out ahead. We'll make some money together, and you'll get on the trader's good side. Want to hear?
Sure. Tell me.
I'll drop by later.

There's this small stalker clan that's settled at Agroprom. They seem like they enjoy delving in tunnels underground, searching for all sorts of scrap. Usually, they don't come back with anything of interest, but they managed to dig up some unique documents during one of their last trips.
 
As you can understand, tons of potential buyers gathered up. Crutch also offered them some decent money, but they never made a deal... and he really wants those documents. I tried stealing 'em a while back, but they caught me, and now that place is off-limits to me.
 
Maybe you could try? The trader will be well satisfied, we'll split the pay, and you'll have a good reputation in our camp too. What do you say?
Interesting offer for sure, but how do you suppose I grab their case?

As I said, I got nowhere with it, but I saw a lot while I was there. I'm thinking on how the documents could be stolen... First of all, they keep the case in a safe with a code lock. Second, I know a stalker who knew a bunch of guys from that clan. The clan partially broke up because of some conflict, and a part of the stalkers left — they were no pushovers but experienced stalkers.\n \nSee where I'm going? They must've known the code, and it just so happens that my buddy hangs out with some of them. I'm thinking those who left the clan wouldn't want for their former pals to make any decent sum out of selling the case. I'll take you to my guy and you discuss the rest. Deal?
Sounds good. I'll try.
Alright, I talked to him. I've sent you the coordinates to Myslav — go see him and discuss everything.
Got it.
Anything new?
Not yet. I'm working on it.
You bet.
Really? Did you get it?
I got it. It went easier than I thought.
I got it and all, but they busted me and threw me out of their area. After that, I stole it anyway.
I had to drop several men. No idea whether it was worth it...
You're really something! High five!
Man, you're unbelievable... I knew you'd get it in the end. Great freakin' job!
For real? Man, you're an animal. 'Least you got the case...
I'm just scared they'll track me down later.
This doesn't feel good to me. They'll probably go looking for me.
Damn. What's gonna happen next?...
Doubt it. They won't go looking for you beyond Agroprom. Go run into the trader's office — he'll be glad to see your efforts. Don't forget about our mutual deal — the money.
Simmer down! Nothing's gonna happen. Bring the case to the trader — he'll be glad to see your efforts. Don't forget about our mutual deal. The money, that is.
I won't.
Stalker, help me out of here...
Hello! What are you doing here?
I didn't think I'd ever sink to this level... but I ran away! I deserted, damn it! Shame on me!
You must've had your reasons, right?
I did. Family problems. I need to go home, but the damn commander won't let me!
Well, you sure ran in the wrong direction!
I know, I know! I don't know my way around this place, so I got lost...
So what do you do now? What are your plans? You're done for once they find you!
I just need to get home, and then whatever happens, happens!... Will you help me?
So you'd just ask any random stranger for help?
But you stalkers help each other...
But you're not a stalker...
Ah, who knows how life will go... What do you say? Will you help me back to the outside?
No-ope! I'm still just a rookie. It's my first time going this far.
I'll pay you! Take everything I have!
Alright. I have an idea.
Sorry. No time.
Well?
There's a guide waiting for us at the big gate. You ready?
I'm ready!
Let's go, then!
Hey!
Hey there! Here's your customer!
A soldier? You sure about him, Axe?
Don't worry. He's a deserter and won't cause any trouble. Promised a handsome fee. I think you two could strike a deal.
I'll take him through the second route, through the pipes, not far from here. The people here just finished clearing out the blockage there, so the path is clear. I hope I don't regret this...
You won't. Later!
Listen, stalker, what's going on? Why's that soldier with you? Or are you with him?
Ease up, guys. It's just a buddy of mine — we snatched it from a soldier. Good armor, I tell you.
Are you two complete idiots? Stalkers are gonna shoot you first and ask questions later! Soon as they see an army uniform in their sight — bang, you're gone. Use your head, you morons!
Didn't think about that. Thanks, guys!
Wait... Something's off here. His armor's all new — no fighting traces!
You just gotta know where to shoot.
You're right about that.
None of your business, buster. Turn around and scram on out of here!
You got a lot of balls. What's the matter with you?

What's the matter with *me*? You're the ones who held us up and started hassling us! Why do you care why I'm with a soldier, and what even makes you think he is a soldier? Now, you get out of our way and stay out of our way, or else...
Alright, then. Let's back out of here, boys. Let 'em get what's coming to 'em.
Good riddance.
Stand down, guys — he's alright. He deserted his unit and asked me to lead him out of the Zone.
Who's alright? *He's* alright? I don't give two shits what you have to say about him! Those army dipshits rob us blind, and now we're supposed to forgive them? You crooked bastard!
Chill! He doesn't want us any trouble — he offered to pay!
Yeah? Then give us half!
Give you half? Were you dropped on your head or something?
You think? Then we'll just take it ourselves!
What's with you?
I'm a guide. That's what I do — lead people around.
This is a soldier we're talking about! Those asswipes grab our artifacts and money, and you're working for him!
I don't give a rat's ass who he is and what he's done. They pay, I lead — simple as that.
What if it's a setup so he can ice you for all the stalking you've done?
If it's like that and I feel something's not right, I'll put a bullet in his head myself. Either way, it doesn't concern you, so relax.
Your funeral, buddy. Just don't bring him anywhere near the camp. Got that?
Of course.
Who the hell are you?
No one. Just a stalker.
Then I say: get out of here, stalker.
You seem uptight... Is Duty always like that? I'm looking for work, and I thought you could help me...
We have our own men to carry out our missions, so you're in the wrong place.
That's unfortunate. Thanks anyway...
Uh... Wait up! I do have something for you. There's this one problem that needs solving, and we need someone that's not from our camp.
If it's dirty work, count me out.
Trust me, that's not how we do things. It's something else.
I'm listening.

Don't take us for a bunch of lunatics, but every night, we have some strange things happening. The boys from the outpost are reporting sounds at night, as if someone's walking around the camp — sniffling, whispering, breathing down their necks... It's making them mighty uncomfortable.\n \nI didn't believe it either until I witnessed it myself. Happened a couple of days ago — I was taking a nap, and then I felt someone breathing behind me. Turned around — nothing... I was ready to shit myself right then and there. Nothing in the Zone's ever creeped me out like that, and it happens again and again every night. Everyone's feeling more and more uneasy by the day, and that gives cause to undue worry and conversation subjects in the outpost.
I might've not been in the Zone for long, but I've learned anything could happen here! Anyway, how can I help?
You're new around here. We need your second opinion: is there really something unnatural about this place or are we all just crazy? Or is it just one of the soldiers pranking us?
I suppose I'll need to keep watch on the camp at night.
Could you do it tonight? It's up to you, but I can guarantee you a reward and free entry to the Bar. You must've not been there yet; the Bar is a great place for resting up and finding work.
Then tonight we'll see what happens.
Let's do it later, commander.
So, stalker, do you want to work with us?
Let's see what's happening here, commander.
I'll come by later.
What do you need, man?
Aren't you supposed to sleep? Are you guarding the fire?

Yeah, right, as if falling asleep here is a thing... When all this crap started, I forgot what a good night's sleep is. I'm scared of all this shit. I'm on edge from not sleeping, and I'm not the only one. I'm thinking of asking command to shift me to the Bar — it's a lot quieter there.
What do you think is happening here at night?
Beats me. Maybe our food was stuffed with psychotropic substances? Could be those Freedom jackasses, playing with us and waiting until we lose it. Drugs... It's just like them.
Forgive me, but that's just being paranoid.
I'm just laying down all options. There has to be some explanation to all of this.
When did these things last happen in the camp?

To be honest with you?... I don't know. Something definitely happened here a few times — it was hard not to notice. But I've been seeing this thing every single night. My gut tells me it's here right now.
Relax. There's no one here. I'll sit here with you, and we'll check whether you're out of your mind or if there really is something at play here.
What's going on?
Wake up!
What? What is it?
I heard it! I saw something! I don't know what's going on here, but I damn near had a heart attack!
Is it gone?
Yes. Can't hear it anymore. There's definitely nothing wrong with you, nor is it anyone's prank!
Well, shit... What is that thing, really?
No idea, but staying here gives me the creeps.
We need to deal with this... What do we do?

I'm gonna see the trader in the abandoned hangar first thing in the morning — I see the stalkers have themselves a nice camp there. I'll ask them about this and see whether they've experienced the same thing.
Good thinking! I'll ask my men for now. Maybe they have some details.
See you later.
What is it, stalker?
Hey! I want to ask you some questions about the Duty outpost.
What does that have to do with me? I'm just a stalker with no ties to Duty.
Have you heard anything strange about their outpost? Any talks or rumors you know of?
Don't think I've heard any talks or rumors. What's your interest in it? What happened there?
I want to know as much as you do... Right, bye!
Hello. What do you need?
Hey! Could I ask you about the Duty outpost at the Garbage?
Well, ask away. I don't get why you're turning to me, though...
There are lots of strange things happened there. I've been tasked with getting to the bottom of it.
Ah, yeah! I've heard about that! Isn't that just some made-up story?
I don't think that's the case...
Well, sucks for you. They played you like a fiddle and you fell for it!
Well, thanks...
Hello there.
Hey! Could I ask you something?
Shoot!
I've been entrusted with finding out what's happening at the Duty outpost. Some real strange stuff is happening there, so I'm asking everyone here. Maybe someone knows about it?

Anything can happen in the Zone! I've heard stories about the outpost, but they don't make much sense. They say all kinds of stuff happen there at night — strange stuff. We even try not to get too close there. I don't know if there's really anything behind it, though.
That's unfortunate...
I suggest you talk to Korvalol. He's been digging into it for some time, and he must've found out something.
Where can I find him?
He went off to find loot. He's gotta be somewhere in the Garbage. Look around the field by the flea market.
Stalker, any news on what's going on?
Not yet. I'm still on it.
Well? What do you need?
Hey there, artifact hunters!
Hello, hello... Need anything?
I do, to be honest. The folks in the camp told me you might know more about what's happening at the Duty outpost.
What "happenings"?
Well, you know, strange stuff happening... I think you know full well what I mean.
Why do you want to know?
Duty asked me to get to the bottom of it, so any clue might help. Any! Even just the littlest things.
I don't get this! When I asked Duty about it, they damn near threatened me to keep my mouth shut and stay out of it.
Really? Is that what they told you?

Well, not exactly that. A rumor passed through our camp that all kinds of crazy stuff was happening at the outpost. Like they were seeing ghosts at night. Now, that kind of stuff really gets me hooked — maybe that's why I got into the Zone in the first place, 'cause I like mysteries. Dealing with them is frightening, sure, but also hella interesting.
What happened next?

I thought, "Is this real? I'm gonna find out." I arrived at their camp and asked them if I could sleep over under their protection. They allowed it... and after I went to sleep, I woke up at night feeling like someone was watching me. I open my eyes and see something in front of me, like a black smoke. Really thick. I stood up, and the smoke evaporated.\n \nI had no idea what that was, and it was clear there was something real mysterious going on. Maybe a new anomaly or some new type of poltergeist. Either way, it creeped me out. Even now, when I think about it, I get the chills.
What did you do then?

What could I do? In the morning, I went to talk to the Duty fighters, and many of them confirmed that something was wrong and that they were constantly being terrorized by something mysterious. It didn't cause any harm, but had them real frightened.
 
I decided to delve into it. I managed to get one of them to talk, and he shared an interesting thought with me: apparently, it's the ghost of a missing fighter of theirs. Two months ago, he went missing, and that's when all of it started happening. His soul comes up to the camp he was stationed at. When I tried learning about his name or any details about his disappearance, naturally, everyone kept their mouth shut. So I left it.
 
That same night, I head back to the stalker camp after going after loot, and then this Duty guy stands there waiting for me. He said, "Listen here, buddy: mind your own business and keep your nose out of Duty's." So I backed off. I steer clear of that place — who knows what they'll do to me otherwise.
Is that so?... Who was that Duty guy? Do you remember?
He was wearing a black mask. Can't tell you for sure, but judging by how he spoke, he's got some experience under his belt — ain't his first day in Duty.
Thanks, you've been a big help! Good hunting, stalker!
Hello. How's the investigation going?
Hello. I have a few leads, but I'll need your help.
Say what you need.
One of your men was threatening a stalker for him not to look into the truth behind what's happening here. I'd like to know who that was.
Out of the question! None of my squadmates go behind my back. I've been through a lot with each and every one of them.
Nevertheless, I think it has to do with the disappearance of one of your soldiers.

So you know about that too? I commend you. Yes, one of my men did go missing: private Galushkin. He was a good, responsible fella — I had plans on making him my right hand. But I seem to be missing what it has to do with this.
The stalker he was threatening asked questions about the soldier's disappearance. Could you tell me more about what happened?
If only I had anything to tell you. I don't really know myself... We had intel on a Freedom stash hidden in the forest, and a three-man squad was assigned to check it. Only two of them returned.
What happened?

At some point, Galushkin fell out of sight and vanished into thin air. My men tried finding him, but without success. We have no clue where he went off too... Maybe he deserted us; I'm not ruling that out.
Where are those other two men now?
Stetsurin left us... He went back to the outside. Averyanov's with us here in the outpost — you can talk to him if necessary.
I'll do that.
What is it?
Hello there! Your commander told me I could ask you a few questions.
Ah... You're that guy who decided to deal with our little "problem." I don't know how I can be of help, though — I'm not the best with anomalies.
You think it's an anomaly?
What else? I don't believe in ghosts, and I don't suggest you do either.
Well, anything can happen...
No need to shove that "Anything can happen in the Zone" stuff in my face. There's a reasonable explanation for everything.
You seem on edge today.
What do you want? Just ask your questions — I don't have the time for this.
Alright. Tell me what happened to Galushkin?
What does that have to do with this? I have nothing to tell you! I reported everything to the commander.
So you have nothing to add? What's your opinion on his disappearance?
He deserted us! There's no other option. He waited for the right moment and separated from us.
Anything else?
I've already told you everything!
Okay, then. You do your thing. Might want to take off that mask — it's hot today...
So? Did you learn anything?
Not yet.
I think I have news for you.
What is it? What did you learn?

At this point, I'm positive your camp is haunted by the ghost of Galushkin, no matter how strange it sounds. I examined the area where he disappeared and found his body at the bottom of a well — your subordinates must've pushed him into it.
Don't be stupid. How can you be so sure?
When I was in the forest, by the well, something happened to me. I saw the ghost, and it made everything clear to me.
Bullshit!

Alright... Then think about it yourself: what kind of treatment did he face among his peers? If I had to guess, I don't think anyone took a liking to him — you trusted him more than the others, and many thought he didn't deserve it at all.
Well, I find that hard to believe...
Then ask Averyanov. When I talked to him, he clearly got nervous. He must be hiding something. Where is he now?
I don't know. He should be here.
So he ran off? I told you. And you're all like, "Bullshit! Bullshit!"
I still don't believe it! Is this really what happened? He was my right hand — he never let me or anyone down once. I don't believe it!
An innocent man wouldn't hide.
True. That explains why Stetsurin would leave Duty: his conscience got the better of him.
He's not the only one. What will you do? You going to let that guy off like that too?
No. This won't go unpunished... His PDA is still pinging! Find him — I guarantee you Duty's gratitude!
I'll try.
So? Where's Averyanov? Did you find him?
It's over. Averyanov's dead. Or not... In any case, he's no longer part of our world. Your fighter got his revenge, despite already being dead. I can't really explain it.
It's over. Averyanov's dead.

Well, call me a whirligig and twist my guts! I can't even wrap my head around it... You're amazing, man. Thanks. I hope we'll stop seeing things at night? Whatever, let's forget about it.\n \nLet's settle your reward: I have an old Abakan with a few attachments, some weathered body armor — just gotta patch it up and it'll be as good as new — or just good old cash. What do you choose?

Thanks, stalker. I hope we'll stop seeing things at night. So it really was Galushkin's ghost looking for revenge? Whatever, let's forget about it.\n \nLet's settle your reward. First off, you're free to enter the Bar at any time. I also have an old Abakan with a few attachments, some weathered body armor — just gotta patch it up and it'll be as good as new — or just good old cash. What do you choose?
Give me the gun.
Body armor? I'll take that!
I'm fine with money, commander.
Good choice. Here you go! Come by anytime, and godspeed to you.
That's right — protection first! Come by when you feel like it, stalker. Good luck.
Well, it's your loss, but also your choice. Thanks again for the help. Good luck to you.
Bye, commander!
Hm? What do you want?
Hello there! I'm looking for work, and was hoping you could help.

Ah, another one... Where do you people get the idea that I've got work just because I'm a trader? That's just what I am: a trader, not an HR manager. If you're interested in any wares, buy them. If not, I won't keep you here. I don't hand out work, especially to newcomers.
I see you're not in the mood.
I believe I made myself perfectly clear! Will you be buying anything?
I'll get my supplies elsewhere. Have a nice day.
I believe we've stated our intents, haven't we? What else do you need?
Nothing. I'm leaving.
Got any more work?
I've got a simple task. There's a bunch of stinking bandits in the tunnel that needs taken care of. Will you do it?
I'll try.
No. I'm not killing anyone.
The bandits won't be troubling you anymore.
Attaboy! Here's your reward!
If anything else comes up, let me know.
What do you need?
Hey there, Crutch!
You again? What is it this time?
I've got something for you. Have a look.
Is that... No way!
You're welcome, you're welcome.
Well now, stalker... rarely am I this impressed! I've been looking for these documents for ages!
They're yours now. Not only am I hoping for a reward, but also for good relations between us.
No problem at all — I'll pay you ten thousand and give you a good backpack. I'm sorry, but that's all I can give you right now. I'm having difficult days, and I need every coin I can get right now.
What happened?
Doesn't matter. What matters is that you're gonna make money. I'll be able to throw you some work every now and then if I have any.
Suits me.
Come back later and I'll have something for you. In the meantime, go see our medic, Gamzat. I'll tell him you can be trusted.
Got it.
So, did the trader pay you?
He paid me, but not much. As I understand it, he's got financial problems right now.
So I've heard. The deal's still on, right? Got my cut?
Yeah. Here.
You know, I was just thinking... Why do both of us get paid when I'm the only one risking my ass? No, I'm keeping it for myself. So long.
See, it just so happens I spent all the dough at the counter...
Great job, stalker. Come by whenever you get the chance. Godspeed!
Oh, so that's how it's gonna be! You'll pay for that sooner or later. Don't let the hangar door hit you in the ass.
See you.
I won't.
Hey there, stalker. How are you holding up?
Hi, stalker.
Come for medical assistance?
Hey, man.
Great to see ya.
Hey...
I need medical help.
Let's see what we've got...
Everything's fine with you, stalker!
[continue...]
Done. Take it easy, now!
Hi! Crutch told me you could offer some work.
He told me about you just now. Said you're a reliable guy, by all accounts, and that you can be trusted. Did he tell you what I do?
You're a doctor, right?
Kind of, but that's just my profession. My hobby, though, is something altogether different.
I wonder where this is going...
I'm interested in the study of mutations in the Zone. Specifically in mutants.
And here I was thinking something else... What is it you do, exactly?
I'll tell you everything, and I'll even give you a first-hand look... if you're trustworthy, of course. That's what we're gonna check.
Is the sum appropriate?
You won't regret it.
Then I'm all ears.
We need to lure an adult bloodsucker out of its lair. You'll distract it and make it come toward you, and I'll fire at with it a tranquilizer.
You want to catch a live bloodsucker? That's one hell of a hobby, and I'm not liking my role in it! I've already been a decoy once, and it wasn't the most fun experience.

Trust me when I say it's worth it. I'll have lots to share with you about mutants after it's done... Don't be afraid. Pretty much all you have to do is lure out the mutant and quickly run to the side. I won't miss with the dart, and I'll put it to sleep. The risks are minimal.
Sorry, but I have to ask: how much are you paying?
If you value money more than information and knowledge on mutants, I won't let you down: ten thousand. No one here in the Garbage is going to find you work that pays better.
I'm in. Let's head off.
Deal, but I have to finish up some things first. I'll return soon.
I'm ready. Let's go.

The bloodsucker was hanging around somewhere in the lowlands, behind my back. I'll climb up here while you bring it toward me. As soon as I see the thing, I'll knock it out at once. Just be careful — the Duty outpost is nearby, and the area around it is mined. Go!
Well, cross your fingers!
Hello. Do you need anything?
Hi! Got anything of interest for sale? Just don't make it too expensive.
Anything your heart desires. Weapons, outfits, supplies... You want good, I give you good!
Let me see. It's about time I update my equipment.
By the way, I've got a little job for you. Gamzat told me you did good, so I'd like to trust you with this.
Did he happen to tell you that a bloodsucker almost ripped my shoulder off?

Oh, come on now. Just a few scrapes and bruises. In any case, either you take this job or I offer it to somebody else. You won't be unloading train cars, so don't worry about your pretty shoulder. Here, have some — it'll make you feel better.
Alright. Tell me what's up.

There's a small bandit base in the Dark Valley. We've established a profitable trading relationship: I buy artifacts from them, and it's time I have my next delivery of loot picked up. All you have to do is go there, talk to their leader Mongol, and pick up the artifact case.
You're doing business with the bandits? They're as crazy as it gets!

The people in the Dark Valley are mostly decent. They have their share of rabble and street garbage, but those types don't usually last long there, so don't worry your head about it. Still, be careful around them.
Do I need to pay them for the case?
Here. Take this and pay them, then get the artifacts. Be careful not to squander it, or you'll be paying up with your own cash.
Got it. I'm off!
Thanks, man. I would've been mutant dinner by now!
Oh, please. Anyone would've done the same. Shooter sent me. What's this about the case?
He must've told you about the clan collapsing, right? I know some of the stalkers that left, and I think one of them knows the safe code.
Alright. Where do I look for them?

That's the hard part. I can't get you in direct touch, but I do know where they usually hang out.
 
The first one, Mitay, was a friend of my late brother — they were great buddies and I was introduced to Mitay by my brother, but when he passed, Mitay and I stopped seeing each other. Then we just so happened to end up in the Zone together. He joined up with that clan while I was working under Crutch. I was there not long ago, before the collapse, and he told me how they found the documents. That night, I got to know two other stalkers from their camp, and we all shared a few drinks. They were really nice folks. Now, those three along with some other people left the clan because of some disagreements. I'm sure one of them knows the safe code, and they'll definitely be glad to help you out. They had a big argument — it won't be profitable if their former "friends" get to sell the documents, which, by the way, are very highly priced.
 
Mitay hangs out somewhere at Agroprom. There are two more: Tail and Barin. Tail usually wanders around the Garbage, and Barin went off to the Cordon.
Woah... So I'm supposed to go looking for some completete strangers? What if they tell me to buzz off?
Don't worry — they won't. Just tell them I sent you and watch their expressions change.
Alright, thanks. I'm going.
Good luck. Thanks for not leaving me here!
Of course.
Thanks, stalker!
Tell me about those stalkers.
Naturally. Who do you want to know about?
Tell me about Mitay.
Tell me about Tail.
Tell me about Barin.
Never mind.

I've already mentioned that he was my late brother's friend. My brother's the one who introduced us, but that's besides the point. When we came to the Zone, we worked for Sidorovich for a long time — back then, there was nothing particularly interesting going on. Together we recovered artifacts and split the pay in half... The guy and I hit things off very well.
 
Now, here's the thing: after the Scorcher was shut down, we made a move for it. I stayed at the Garbage, but Mitay went all the way to the area around Jupiter. After he returned, he told me he had some trouble with the bandits — even ending up in captivity — but he turned out fine in the end after he was rescued by a few stalkers. Oh, and get this: one of them was part of the military... from the USS, I think. What a twist that was!
 
Anyway, he stuck around for a while and then went the opposite way toward the Zone's outskirts, after which he joined up with the diggers at Agroprom. That's the story of that stalker.

Interesting guy for sure, though a bit of an oddball. Back then, I met up with them to talk to Mitay. As I told you, they found the documents that day and drank in celebration of their discovery, and Tail suggested I stay when I was getting ready to leave. We hung out and talked about the lives we've made in the Zone. He told me interesting stories about the many places he's seen — a travel-crazy guy for sure. To my surprise, though, he didn't tell me a lot about himself, so I don't know anything else about him. All in all, a good stalker, if a bit closed up...

He used to be part of Duty. Not the most likeable type, actually. I suppose we had a good time drinking, but the vibes he gave off... bit too slithery to my liking. I heard he left Duty for unclear reasons, and he still had his service equipment, which he still carries around the Zone. After that, when Mitay told me about him, it turns out I was right: a very greedy and squeamish person who looks for profit around every corner... That's that about Barin. I only saw him once, so I can't tell you anything else.
Thanks.
I've already told you about each of them.
I need to tell you something.
Sure. What is it?
I found Mitay's body. I'm sorry.
Tail's dead. I found his body here at the Garbage.
Barin's dead. I found his body at the Cordon.
Mitay?! Man, how's that possible?... How did that happen?
You're serious? Christ... What happened to him?
Barin? Hm. After all he's done, can't say I'm that surprised.
Sorry, but I don't know.
No clue.
I didn't know him, so I can't say.
What a man he was! Now I'm alone in this stinking Zone! Thanks for telling me. Here's for you...
I didn't really know him at all, but it's still a shame.
Still, I feel sorry for the guy.
Well, stalker? Anything new to tell?
Not yet. I'm going to see Myslaw.
Well, hurry up!
Well, stalker? Did Myslaw tell you anything?

Yeah. He told me about a few stalkers that left the digger clan because of some conflict. He knows three of them personally and tipped me off on where to find them. According to Myslav, one of them is sure to know the safe code.
Great. I'll be waiting for news!
I'll come by first thing.
Myslaw's dead... I'm sorry. I retrieved info on three of his acquaintances from the digger clan. I believe one of them knows the safe code. I'll go look for them.
Shit! How could this happen to you, Myslaw?...
It just happened.
So, anything new?
Not so far. I'm working on it.
Yes, I've got the case. Had to go through a whole lot of effort to get it without bloodshed...
Yes, I've got the case, but bullets were fired in the process.
That's the way to go! So they didn't even spot you?

Holy shit, man. How'd you do that? They were alright people, I guess, yet you went that far... Whatever, enough about that. Go see the trader and watch him light up when you give him the stuff. And don't forget about our mutual deal — the money.
As I was going away, they still noticed it was gone. I overheard their radio chatter. Shit, they'll be looking for me now!
I doubt it — they won't leave Agroprom to find you. Go see the trader and watch him light up when you give him the stuff. Don't forget about our mutual deal — the money.
I won't.
Finally!
Here I am!
Did you first walk to the power plant before going into the Dark Valley? Where were you? Did anything happen?
No, it's just that...
Let me guess: you lost a card game?
Yeah! I don't know what got into me, but it happened. I played with those cheats.
I hope you didn't lose the case, at least?
No, it's all here. Open it and see for yourself.

Alright. Not bad for your first time... though my customers aren't happy I kept them waiting. Remember this: I see the same tempo in the future, you're not getting any more work. If anything else comes up, I'll drop you a line. Now go.
Later.
Hey there, old friend! You got a moment?
I'm just gonna bring Crutch what he's been promised and then we'll talk.
Hey there, old friend! Where've you been?
Oh, hey, mutant hunter! I was in the Dark Valley on some important business.
I see. So you're still eager for some jobs? Do you want to continue our line of work?
Sorry, but if it's about running from mutants again, I can't. My shoulder was all screwed up after last time.
Don't worry, you wouldn't have to do any more running. I could use your help with something else.
I'm all ears.
Let's head to my shelter. No one needs to hear.
Let's go.
We'll meet there.
We're here.
Can we talk now? What's with the secrecy?
No one needs to know there's a bloodsucker living right next to the stalker base, even in its current state.
Makes sense. How did you even calm it down?

Long story. I worked on it back when I was in the science base, but after our superiors saw my project as too questionable and dangerous, it was shut down. I tried continuing the research in secret with a group of like-minded associates, but they found out. After that, I had to say my goodbyes to science and join with the stalkers in their base. The point of our research was to try eliminating aggression in mutants. Fight fire with fire, so to speak... by using artifacts.
Interesting. Artifacts have always interested me.

So, this one time, we discovered by sheer chance that we could use a Compass to affect mutant behavior... not to a large extent, but that made us reflect deeply. I started doing selective artifact breeding — basically frankensteining two artifacts to make something new — and one day, I was able to achieve a set of artifact properties that have a positive effect on mutant behavior.
So that's the artifact I saw on your table! I always thought selective artifact breeding was just made up. I remember seeing this one guy throwing dog tails and vodka into an anomaly to get a Gravi.
Hehe. Did it work out for him?
Well, what do you think? The guys in the village were left with no artifact and no vodka.

Well, it's not that simple. There are a lot of factors at play, and good equipment helps too. Unfortunately, working away from the scientific facility made everything tougher for me. If I didn't have those colleagues that helped me, things would've been rough.
So, you transmuted an artifact, and now you can control the bloodsucker?

I wish. Only thing I can do right now is pacify it by putting it to sleep. I have to carry out additional tests in order to stop one — or even several — mutants with an artifact in hand. I wouldn't want to invite any more people to the project. If they hear about the bloodsucker, it won't be pretty. My role as their medic won't matter anymore.
What are we gonna do?

I carried out a new artifact selection that I believe is ready for testing. You and I will head out to the field where there's been a pack of dogs these past few days, and we'll try to pacify them. You'll walk behind me with the artifact, and I'll cover you with my rifle just in case. Sound good?
Yeah. So I carry the artifact while you keep me covered?
Yep. If anything goes wrong, we'll just run away, but everything should be fine. The dogs shouldn't even bite through our suits.
Let's go, then.
How are you doing?
Hey, stay with me! Let's get you patched up, ???
Well, look who it is! How are you? How's your head?
Hey! It's fine, I'll live. How are *you* doing? Did you get settled in?

I sure did, alright. While these stalkers were short of a medic, they started healing themselves. All the medical bags are used up — everything's used up! Not a single bandage left either. What am I supposed to use to patch them up?
The trader, Crutch, manages everything here. Maybe ask him?
I've already asked him. He gave me money for medical supplies, but where do I get them? "Ain't my problem," he says.
Maybe I can help? Duty has an outpost nearby — maybe they have medical supplies to spare.
I can't help you. Sorry.
Really? You can? It'd be great!
Don't worry. I'll manage somehow.
I'll try.
Good luck to you.
I think there's a chance I could help you with your medical supplies.
Really? Got any ideas?
I'll try visiting the Duty outpost and asking their man in charge.
That'd be great!
Wait for me.
What's your business?
Hello. Do you have any medical kits to spare? It's for the local stalker base. I'll pay if necessary.
Funny. You think I'm going to sell medical supplies handed out to us under the radar?
I thought we could make a deal.
Hm. Perhaps. But it's not money we need... well, everyone needs money, but we have more important things at hand. If you can provide us assistance, we'll hand out a few medical bags.
What do you need?

There's a pack of boars that turned up not far from here. If that place isn't cleaned out right now, they'll be heading toward the outpost sooner or later. Deal with them and you'll get your supplies.
Alright. I'll do it.
Did you do it?
Yep. No idea why you didn't do it yourselves. So much for protecting the world from the expanding Zone.
Not yet.
We've got more important things to deal with right now. Here's what you asked for. If you want more mutants to shoot down, come see me.
Thanks. See you.
So, did you get the medical supplies?
Yeah. It's not much, but it should suffice for some time.
Not yet. Wait.
Well, thank you kindly! You're not walking out of here unrewarded — I know a place with some real juicy loot. You interested?
Of course!

Just recently, the scientists from our facility made a trip to the Garbage to research an anomaly. I know for sure that anomaly was an Electro. They stood there and gathered their data until a wave of mutants came at 'em. The soldiers tried to fend them off, but... they had to make it out of there. Dropped all their things and went on the run. If the locals haven't found that place and grabbed those supplies yet, they should still be there. Unfortunately, I can't pinpoint the exact spot, but look around the big Electro.
Thanks. I'll look for it when I get the chance.
You again... What do you want?
I'm listening.
What do you want, stalker?
Speak up.
Well, I'm all ears.
What is it?
What do you need?
What are you looking at?
Spill it.
I'm listening.
Go on. Say what you've got to say.
Say your words.
Go ahead. Say it.
Shoot.
Got any questions?
Glad to see you in one piece again! Coming onto a group of bandits in the Bar... You're something else!
I've been having terrible luck lately — not my first time getting hit in the head. Good thing I'm still alive.

Yep. Anyway, about the sergeant: I wanted to bring him a little something, his old badge that he lost after drinking with me. I had amazing luck recently — bought it off the locals. And give him this artifact too so he can give it to the scientists when he gets the chance.
Deal. I'll hand it to him when I'm in the Bar.
Good luck to you. If you get the time, come see me — I could give you artifact orders.
Alright. Until next time.
Goodbye.
Bye.
I'm going.
Heya.
Hey there.
What've you got?
Hm? What is it? Haven't seen you here before...
What do you need, man?
What do you want?
I'm going.
Bye.
Goodbye.
Need a patch-up, wanderer?
Did you take one? Need medical assistance?
What do you need, buddy?
Yeah? What do you need?
Tell me what you need?
What is it?
Stay out of the way, pal.
Thanks for helping me! The colonel would've killed me for that detector!

You shut your mouth! I'm not even going to ask what you were doing here. I know about you and the colonel's relations, and I don't give two shits about it as long as I have nothing to do with it. I hope you and I are on clear terms and that you won't drag me into your business. Better yet, stay out of my squad's way.
But the colonel assigned me to your squad...
Oh, right. He did. So, your role in the squad is to stay out of our sight. Go do your own thing. Go bring your artifacts to your daddy colonel, and say hi to him for me.
How's the investigation going, then? Need any help?
The last thing I want to do is involve you. Go hunt some artifacts, stalker.
So you don't need any information? I didn't join up with your squad for nothing — I haven't been sitting idly by.
Really now? What information could that be?
A couple of days ago, a group of stalkers I know came across some armed soldiers. Judging by what I heard, they really look like the ones that were seen at Agroprom the day the professor disappeared.
Where did this happen? Did the stalkers come out alive?
They ran away. It happened in the area around the abandoned army warehouses. We could go verify it — we'll arrive in a few hours if we move.
Thanks for the information, but I'll be acting alone as before. Where do I find these stalkers so I can question them?

They didn't make any more radio contact... Ask the local trader about them — I'll give you his coordinates. If I were you, I wouldn't turn down any help — the safest route to the warehouses is through the Bar, and if anyone finds out you're no stalker...
I'll deal with it. And remember, if this info's just made-up and I waste my time, your head's gonna roll.
I know those stalkers well. They've always shared useful information with me...
What are their names?
I only know one personally: Chord.
Right. Get back to Agroprom. Try not to stain yourself.
Commander?
Glad to see you, boss?
Anything else?
Bye.
Watch yourself.
Later.
The bandits on the farm won't bother your men any more.
That's great news, stalker. Thanks! I'll let our superiors know they can send a squad there.
What's in it for me?
Something in return, eh? Here you go. Honest reward for honest work.
Now we're talking. 'Til next time!
What're you staring at? Get the PDA out of the stash and read it. I'll cover you.
The stash is in the stump?
What did you expect? I didn't have time to think.
Let's see.
It says one of the people who died after the events punched in the coordinates of his buddy's PDA into his own so that "he wouldn't get lost." Here's his location.
Maybe his pal's got the info and goods?
I doubt the goods would vanish like that. Survivors must've taken it. Let's head to the coordinates.
Let's go.
Why, hello, good sir. New here? Who might you be?
Hi! Yeah, haven't been here long. Name's Axe, regular stalker. What do you do here?
I'm Vitka. I trade custom weapons and armor. I also buy any other goods at a cheap price, whether it be weapons or armored suits.
So I can talk to you if I need anything?
Of course. You can take a look at my assortment. It's not an instant delivery, but it won't take me more than forty-eight hours. Name any rare shooters or armor and it's yours!
I'll keep that in mind.
Hi! Need anything?
Hello, stalker.
I'm all ears.
I'd like to make an order.
Of course! Weapons or armor?
Weapons.
Armor.
Changed my mind.
Excellent. What arms are you looking for?
What kind of protection would you like?
Pistols.
Shotguns.
Submachine guns.
Assault rifles.
Sniper rifles.
Here's what I can offer you:\n \n
Headgear.
Faction suits.
Light armor.
Scientific suits.
Heavy armor.
Exoskeletons.
I'll go with that.
I'll take it!
That's a deal.
I can't afford that right now.
That's a bit on the expensive side.
I don't have that much...
I'll come by another time.
I've changed my mind.
I'll give it some thought.
An excellent choice! That'll be
A deal it is. That'll cost you
Not a bad choice. That's
The goods will arrive in around twenty-four hours. I'll message you then.
The goods will be here in about two days. You can go about your business until then, and I'll notify you.
See you later, then.
Thank you. Bye.
Superb. I'll see you around.
The order's not here yet, stalker. If you want, we can trade in the meantime.
Come by later. Your order isn't ready yet.
Order's not ready yet. I'll message you when you can come by.
Welcome back! The goods have arrived.
Just in time! Your order's here, stalker. Here you go.
Stalker, your order's here. You're very much welcome!
Thanks! I'm off to try this out.
Thanks! I'd say it was worth it.
A fine product. I'll drop by some other time. Thanks!
Hey! Did you see that too? I'm not imagining it, am I?!
Yeah... hell knows what it was, but life certainly didn't prepare me for this.
How are we supposed to live with that?
Same as before. I guess...
What's up? What kind of urgent business were you having?
A group of stalkers I personally know asked me to find a man for some urgent work. I tried contacting them recently — but nothing from their end.
What did they need help with?
That you can go figure out yourself. But first — we need to figure out why they are not answering.
Give me their location, I'll go look for them.
Last time we spoke they said that they stopped near the village houses at the swamp... Well, what are you waiting here for? Go.
I'll see you later.
I hear you've got old Soviet songs on your radio too?

Just like everywhere else! There's only one radio station in the Zone, the one you're listening to right now. That's where they play these songs. Some say that there is a man in the Zone who organised the radio broadcast, and others believe that the signal comes from the past. Whatever, I don't care. Music and music. It's more fun than the jokes and songs of failed guitarists coming from the camp behind the wall!
